Basics.When adding Rythm I can't see my server:
You need to have a role with “Administrator” or “Manage server” permissions to be able to add a Bot (Rythm) to a Discord Server.

If you have the right permissions and still can’t see your server in the list, make sure you’re logged in into the correct discord account in your web browser.
Basics.Rythm left the voice channel after 2 min:
For performance reasons, Rythm leaves after 2 minutes of it being alone in a voice channel.
This helps Rhythm save resources while no one is listening to it and keeps the music quality
consistent for all users at any given time!

Don't worry though, as long as you are in a voice channel, just type !summon to make Rythm join your channel!
Basics.Rythm messages come out blank:
Rythm uses something called rich embeds for the messages, which is an option that might be disabled on your client. Make sure to enable it!

To do so:

Go to your discord settings > click on "Text & Images" > Enable "Show website preview info from links pasted into chat” .
Basics.Rythm does not respond to commands:
If Rhythm isn’t responding to commands, try the following:


• Make sure you’re using the right Rythm prefix. You can see the current prefix
for Rythm by Mentioning the bot. Example: @Rythm#3722

Mentioning the bot won't work if the channel you're using is blacklisted.
When you mention the bot, do it in a channel where Rythm can read and execute commands in.


• Make sure Rythm has permissions to send messages in the text channel.
You can give “Administrator” permissions to the bot to make this easier.


• Change Server region. If none of the above work, you can try changing the Server Region
in order to fix the issue. Any other should work, although a USA region is recommended
for better Bot performance.
Basics.Tried to be smart and changed the Rythm:
If you have changed the default Rythm prefix to a custom one and now can’t make Rythm work
or aren’t able to change the prefix back, do the following:



1- Mention the bot.

You can do this by typing: @Rythm3722

Note: Mentioning the bot won’t work if the channel you used is Blacklisted.
When you mention the bot, do it in a channel the bot can read in.



2- Copy the Prefix response .

After mentioning Rythm, it should give you a message similar to this:



You must Copy the part that is marked in red.



3- Run the prefix command.

Paste the copied text in the chat box and right next to it with no spaces type: settings prefix !

Example: To set the prefix back to ! in the above picture, the command would be this:

;2Test-)29dsettings prefix !


Note: You must have a role with “Administrator” or “Manage Server” permissions to be able to change Rythm’s prefix.
